meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah was outshouting her opponent to distract them.
meanings.sent2: The fans were outshouting each other to show support for their teams.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were outshouting each other over who gets to use the TV first.
meanings.sent4: His voice outshouting the noise of the crowd, he made his point heard.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice outshouting the students brought the classroom to order.

meanings.definition: The act of shouting louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The outshouting in the room made it hard to focus on the presentation.
meanings.sent2: Her outshouting in the argument showed her determination to be heard.
meanings.sent3: The outshouting between the siblings turned into a playful competition.
meanings.sent4: The outshouting of the protesters echoed through the streets, demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The outshouting of the fans created an electric atmosphere in the stadium.
